moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bc4: white looking for fried Liver attack
moves.4. Nc3 a6: block knight advancement on other side
moves.6. Bd2 d6 7. h3 b5 8. Bb3 Rb8: To avoid knight pin with white bishop d5
moves.9... Bxd2+: taken saw dark squared bishop heading into trouble later in game
moves.10. Qxd2 Nge7: exchange offered on whites troublesome knight
moves.11... a5: looking to trap bishop & gain space
moves.14... Nxe7: takes with Knight not queen as gives knight spring baord to mount king side attack
moves.15. Nh4 Be6: with nasty pin on pawn & king white offers exchange on bishops & hope to open file for rook
moves.17. Nh2: white is losing all tempo and instead of going forward is lacking game plan & aggressive play
moves.17... Nf4: with potential kinght sac for 2 pawns and the defense been opened up infront of king
moves.18... Qf6: more weight linned up towards the king
moves.19... Qg6: fails to distract black at worst would free up D file or block light bishop if pawn passed
moves.20... Qg5: keeps on the wanted file & attacks knight
moves.24. dxe5 dxe5 25. Nxe5: white in serious trouble & not able to defend all his pieces
moves.25... Rfe8 26. Nd7 Rbd8 27. Rac1 Qxb2 28: white queen gobbles pawns on her rounds
black looking for 2nd queen if not just aims to give white a real defenseive headache
moves.36. Ra1 Qc3 37. Rdd1 Ra5 38. Rdc1 Qd4+ 3: at this point black looking to exchange queen for both rooks
moves.40. Rcd1 Rb5 41. Rac1 Qb1: finally black decides to exchange both queen & rook for 2 rooks
